
Intercepted comms from a hacker group using RSA with both primes as Blum integers. Can you decrypt their secret message? Ciphertext: 6451261728424497899242297725285933882172096257104253084591720444337192190859742742000946408085323607486070214255501014880449111410770097335337545827706010

n=7390935027114326455199914041762436607918786668416937136433343982234769263553391859972131665121242739963742475522478062271915731542836759207382767791979829, e=3304692969704421684447906173829651064795860208010468934460347024432343850851707863801870173185221431517909742667797397008583255023285638120006592420722503

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{rwr1sky5}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 6451261728424497899242297725285933882172096257104253084591720444337192190859742742000946408085323607486070214255501014880449111410770097335337545827706010
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=7390935027114326455199914041762436607918786668416937136433343982234769263553391859972131665121242739963742475522478062271915731542836759207382767791979829, e=3304692969704421684447906173829651064795860208010468934460347024432343850851707863801870173185221431517909742667797397008583255023285638120006592420722503
The lower 104 bits of p are: 74954804959259584018567111424748874347

extra_info: p=82251460851044917654665497279845868214833734444066859993057299225959748135531, q=89857796452990688216777676495635236203348348699103344553168941542737148878559, Ï†(n)=7390935027114326455199914041762436607918786668416937136433343982234769263553219750714827629515371296789966994418059880188772561338290532966614070894965740
